intro: Souroubea sympetala, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often pubescent. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces yellowish-orange fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
